main event: On September 15, 1957, a round object approximately 13 inches in diameter was observed moving in a level, straight-line course in Nevada.
interesting points: The observed object was round and silent,The sighting group consisted of one observer,There were various hypotheses including balloon and aircraft, though no conclusion could be definitively reached,The object remained stationary for a period before disappearing,The conditions at the time of observation were clear, with no cloud cover.
sighted object: round object about 13 inches in diameter
location: 5 miles south of Lincoln County Line, Nevada, USA
witness description: One observer traveling North on U.S. Highway 93 near Las Vegas, Nevada
